description:
Font states "installing" indefinitely. Some fonts gets installed, some dont (FiraCode-Retina + FiraCode-SemiBold). 
[Fedora 40, Gnome 46, Wayland]
Unfornatuly didnt work,in my case to install FireCode Retina or jetbrain fonts
it doesn't work. takes ages to load. frustrating constant crashes

good app
 can be used just fine

All fonts displayed a generic capital-A, making them indistinguishable in an X.org display session, so I uninstalled the gnome-font-viewer snap. Then I reconsidered and restarted a Wayland session, and reinstalled the snap from the command line:
  sudo snap install gnome-font-viewer
This time, on starting the application, the font display slowly began to populate with identifiable fonts, and seems to working as designed. I haven't tried installing any fonts from non-repo downloads (freeware novelty ttf web sites) because I don't need any more. But I assume it's done by right-clicking on a .ttf font in Nautilus and selecting open with gnome-font-viewer.
summary: Works on Wayland, maybe not on X.org

description: Unresponsive and often crashes. Very poor app
I wanted to use it for the things it literally says it can do in the description. The only thing you can do is view already installed fonts. You cannot do anything else with this app.
summary: Unreliable, cannot use it to install fonts

description: It only shows fonts

This could have been a great little lightweight font manger. But it crashes everytime I open it. There is no function to add or remove fonts, or any type of helpful font function. It's a viewer, but it's not because it crashes constantly. On the search for a better font manager.
summary: Always crashes. Unusable. Just a viewer. No functionality

description:
This app does not fit with the Mantra of Linux - it is buggy, latent, lazy, unstable, near useless, pointless.
Entire repo and project shoujld be put in the #trash

I run Ubuntu desktop on a VM with suitable specs to be a plex server. When I removed gnome font viewer tonight after musch pain.
I had to sudo apt-get remove gnome-font-viewer
Which then reported I needed to run $ sudo apt --fix-broken install WHICH THEN reported I needed to run; sudo dpkg --configure -a 

AAAAND THEEEEN
sudo apt-get remove gnome-font-viewer 

I N S T A N T   V M  P E R F O R M A N C E  I M P R O V E M E N T
(As in, I was able top type this and actually see the characters appear as I typed them..... )
wow wow wow wow wow
App works fine for me on Flatpak. To anyone who is complaining without sending a bug report - maybe try that? Nothing will be fixed unless you help the project help you... :p

Idk about all the negative reviews but for me it works perfectly fine 🙂 

Using Universal Blue, Fedora 38.

Not sure what is going wrong with all other reviews, but it works perfectly. Perfect to install fonts, and browsing/looking through install fonts works fine even with the obscure branded fonts I've installed from my university.
Ignore the old reviews. It does install fonts - and it does so well! ☺️
Nadassssssssssssssss
legère et rapide
Пытаюсь открыть прогу для проверки наличия шрифта, прога жестко зависает и через некоторое время всплывает предложение о принудительном завершении. Так и не смог ни разу воспользоваться. Ubuntu 20.04

Нельзя добавить шрифт когда не висит (1 из 10) раз
Абсолютно уебанская программа.
Вполне себе не плохое минималистичное приложение для просмотра установленных в системе шрифтов.
